Posts.Title: Got the call at noon... njmae worriedwoman

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 01:45AM PegPinGa wrote: Please try to remain calm Mama (I know it isn't easy) I had a Birads 4 Pleomorphic clustered calcs and they were benign.  I hope that yours turn out the same.  Hugs and good thoughts coming your way and please let us know how it goes. P.S. Biopsy was just fine for me.  I followed the same instructions for mammo and didn't need anything for pain.  We'll all be thinking of you!!
Posts.Title: Biopsy tomorrow...can pleomorphic be benign? mamatoboyz wonderfullymade

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 06:21PM PegPinGa wrote: TrustingHope, you will be fine in the afternoon. I drove myself to the biopsy and I had a Birad 4 pleomorphic cluster of calcifications that were benign. Put the ice pack they give you in your bra and if you have pain, take some Tylenol. It really is more scary sounding than it actually is. So glad that you were able to get in so soon instead of having to wait. The waiting is the hardest part. Hugs to you and keep us posted on your results, we're all here to support you!

Posts.Title: Diagnostic Mammogram today.... NJvictoria Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 07:54PM PegPinGa wrote: Poochie, Please don't take this the wrong way but you might get more replies or help if you stick with one thread. You start a new thread every time you have a new thought and people really can't follow what you are talking about. We are all here to help and support you but if you start a dozen threads about the same subject, it's hard to follow. I hope that you will find the answers you are searching for and you deserve the best care out there. It sounds like you have found a place where you will get good care at a price you can afford. Keep us posted and I'll keep you in my thoughts. Hugs to you, Peg

Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 07:50AM PegPinGa wrote: Yes, please remain optomistic.  In Dec., I had pleomorphic clustered calcs and Dr. Google had me convinced it was cancer.  I was also having trouble with my back and hip, so of course I was sure that I also had bone mets!  When my surgeon called to tell me they were benign, I almost didn't believe it!  Our minds can wander to strange places while we are waiting for results but please remember that most calcs are benign.  Big hugs to you and I wish you the same outcome of my biopsies.  Let us know how it goes...we are all here for you!  Peg
Posts.Title: trying to be optimistic kmms-kids PegPinGa

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 04:05AM PegPinGa wrote: kmms, I had 3 clusters and they were not there on my mammo last year but I expect to go through this again when I go back to be checked in June.  The last part of the path report says " in a setting of fibrocystic changes of the breast showing additional microcalcifications" Doesn't that mean that there are more still there?  Well, I'll just take it a step at a time and see what happens.  Again, I am hoping for a benign result for you and I hope that comes today!!  I'll be watching for some news from you. Peg
